intro: Peucedanum rechingeri, commonly known as the Armenian angelica, is a herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, with finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are small and white to pale green, arranged in complex umbels. The roots of Peucedanum rechingeri are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
